image.altText: A helicopter flying in the air at sunset.

props.synopsis: A Chinese military jet has detonated flares near an Australian Navy helicopter which was operating in international waters, forcing the pilot to take evasive action to avoid an accident.

title.children: Australian helicopter forced to take evasive action after Chinese fighter detonates flares

image.altText: Police block roads on a deserted street at night

props.synopsis: Premier Roger Cook says a letter was sent to WA's education minister with concerns about the behaviour of the teen, who was a student at Rossmoyne Senior High School, where parents are expressing shock about the incident.

title.children: 'I have no words': Parents express shock after Perth high school student is shot dead by police

image.altText: A family of eight bundled up on a cart pulled by a donkey

props.synopsis: Israel's armed forces have begun evacuating civilians from Gaza's southernmost city as an invasion by the IDF looms.

title.children: Penny Wong warns Israel 'should not go down this path' as civilians told to evacuate Rafah

image.altText: Anthony Albanese distances his government from Community Protection Board

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese used to get frustrated at questions he felt should have been asked of the government of the day. Now in government, the prime minster appears frustrated when asked questions about decisions his government has made.

title.children: Albanese is eager to blame anyone but his government. The Westminster system doesn't work like that

image.altText: Callum and Jake smiling and holding a dog.

props.synopsis: Mexican authorities say they believe two Australian tourists and their American friend were shot dead by thieves who were trying to steal their car for its tyres.

title.children: 'Wanted to steal their tyres': Aussie brothers confirmed dead in what Mexican police say was botched robbery

image.altText: A view looking towards suburban housing from a golf course fairway.

props.synopsis: Adrienne and Glenn Pearson joined about 700 neighbours for a court showdown against a housing development on an abandoned golf course, but now the Queensland government has stepped in.

title.children: This empty golf course could be 'called in' to increase housing supply. Experts say it might be wishful thinking

image.altText: A photo of a man in a white tux

props.synopsis: The Australian actor won a silver Logie for his role as Sergeant Frank Gilroy in popular 1980s soap A Country Practice.

title.children: Brian Wenzel, best known for role in A Country Practice, dies aged 94

image.altText: County Court judge Geoff Chettle.

props.synopsis: A Victorian judge has been reprimanded for using "demeaning" and "gratuitous" language towards a woman at the centre of a sexual assault trial.

title.children: Victorian judge 'lacked sensitivity' towards alleged sexual assault victim, judicial watchdog finds

image.altText: David McBride looks into the camera in a tight closeup portrait. He is wearing glasses and stands in a dark room.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors are calling for former military lawyer David McBride to be jailed for stealing and unlawfully sharing classified material. McBride's lawyers are urging the court to find his motivation for sharing the material with journalists to be honourable.

title.children: 'He honestly believed he was not committing an offence': David McBride faces sentencing for sharing classified documents

image.altText: A composite image of three men, all looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Russia's policy of encouraging convicts to bolster its invasion of Ukraine was simple — survive six months and get your freedom. Some returned to the communities they once terrorised, only to commit new crimes.

title.children: Putin told killers and cannibals to 'atone for their crime on the battlefield'. It didn't end well

image.altText: A woman sits on the ground speaking to a person.

props.synopsis: A Queensland paramedic has established her own training project hoping to boost trauma-informed practice among first responders.

title.children: A Queensland paramedic says there's a gap in trauma-informed care training, and she is hoping to fix it

image.altText: Yarra Valley Grammar School sign

props.synopsis: Three male students at Yarra Valley Grammar are suspended after staff discovered a spreadsheet where the students used highly offensive terms to rate female pupils.

title.children: 'Shocked and outraged': Melbourne private school says it's contacted police over ranking of female students

image.altText: An elderly man exits court, a man and woman (his legal team) walk beside him.

props.synopsis: Leonard Gardiner, now in his 80s, has been taken into custody after a jury returned two guilty verdicts on Monday afternoon.

title.children: Former teacher found guilty of historic sexual abuse at The Armidale School in retrial

image.altText: Two photos of two men with dark hair and bears, wearing high necked tops and standing in front of white backdrops.

props.synopsis: Detectives say they are searching for brothers Abhijeet Abhijeet and Robin Gartan who fled a violent dispute that left one man dead and another injured in Ormond on Sunday.

title.children: Police search for two brothers after fatal stabbing in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Composite thumb Dean Winter, Hobart stadium.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Labor announces it will support the proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium in Hobart, all but assuring it will pass parliament.

title.children: Hobart AFL stadium at Macquarie Point a near certainty as Labor lends its support

image.altText: A for lease sign in front of a house

props.synopsis: Rents have reached a record high with the national median weekly cost now at $627, pushing renters further to the outskirts of capital cities.

title.children: Rental crisis ripples out to outer suburbs as Australia's median rent reaches new high

image.altText: A cruise ship from above surrounded by choppy seas.

props.synopsis: A body has been found as part of a search for a man missing off a cruise ship near Sydney.

title.children: Body found in major search for passenger missing from cruise ship near Sydney

image.altText: koala pic thumbnail

props.synopsis: They have a reputation for being lazy and sleeping all day, but this koala made a surprise entry in this year's Ironman Australia triathlon at Port Macquarie.

title.children: Koala 'on a mission' surprises athletes in Ironman Australia triathlon

image.altText: A composite image of a black and white photo of a man smiling and a headstone on a grave.

props.synopsis: Volunteers are repainting hundreds of headstones at a cemetery in Far North Queensland and learning a lot about the people buried there.

title.children: Discovery of air force pilot's run-down grave prompts major makeover for 'forgotten, lost place'

image.altText: Carmel Rugolino with her ex-husband and two sons celebrating a birthday

props.synopsis: Carmel was readying to begin her journey to motherhood alone, but a phone call while on a lunch break with a colleague changed that.

title.children: I asked my coworker to be my sperm donor. Then we fell in love

image.altText: A shot of a rural property with police cars from above.

props.synopsis: Police have kept an active crime scene in Mount Mee, north of Brisbane, since Wednesday night, with divers and other specialist teams called in.

title.children: Man and woman charged with murder, torture over death of man allegedly held on rural property for three days

props.synopsis: It is an area servicing one of the fastest-growing Indigenous populations in the country. But in Dandenong, in Melbourne's south-east, a vital centre for Aboriginal health is falling apart.

title.children: Beloved Aboriginal community centre 'crumbling'

image.altText: Composite of rappers Drake and Kendrick Lamar

props.synopsis: The war of words between hip hop's two biggest stars has taken a nasty turn with allegations of domestic violence, secret children, paedophilia and more.

title.children: Drake responds to Kendrick Lamar's 'paedophile' allegations as nasty rap feud escalates

image.altText: A group of border collies in a pen at a dog trial and sale show.

props.synopsis: The popularity of working dogs like border collies and kelpies is rising. Highly trained dogs are filling the workforce shortage gaps for farmers, but the price tag for a worker this efficient is high.

title.children: As farmers struggle to find workers across Australia, many are turning to man's best friend to get the job done

image.altText: several red heeler puppies, one looking wet and small, inside a car with a police officer

props.synopsis: Seven red heeler puppies were pulled from the banks and water of the Port River, while two cats were left stranded on the side of a highway in the Mid North.

title.children: Puppies and cats allegedly dumped — police and RSPCA appeal for help

image.altText: A woman pulls a sheep out of a race, ready to shear.

props.synopsis: The 31-year-old NSW shearer has set the first Australian women's merino shearing record for the most ewes shorn in an eight-hour period.

title.children: Ewe beauty: Trailblazing Jeanine Kimm shears her way to an Australian record

image.altText: Close-up shot of Scales of Justice statue in Brisbane CBD on August 1, 2018.

props.synopsis: A tribunal has overturned a decision to cancel New Zealand-born Leroy Wilton's visa, despite him having been jailed over an attack on a New South Wales woman in which he used a bat as a weapon.

title.children: New Zealander convicted over domestic violence offences wins tribunal appeal against deportation

image.altText: A wide shots of dozens of sea lions crowding docks at pier 39.

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 sea lions can be seen at San Francisco's Pier 39 — a number not seen at that spot since 1989.

title.children: Anchovy feast draws scores of sea lions to famous San Francisco pier

image.altText: Dirty money image

props.synopsis: Buying a home? Soon you won't have as much competition from drug dealers, corrupt officials and criminals with dirty money thanks to new laws and a boost to enforcement.

title.children: Australian homes have been 'a very attractive destination for dirty money', but that's about to change

image.altText: Blonde woman holds eye iPad to her face. The iPad screen shows the covered side of her face as a glam photograph

props.synopsis: Chelsea Bonner has been fighting to change unrealistic perceptions of beauty for decades. Now she's taking on her biggest foe yet – artificial intelligence.

title.children: Meet the woman taking on AI, its 'fake' models and alarming beauty standards

image.altText: Qantas plane on the runway at Brisbane airport

props.synopsis: Qantas reaches a $120 million agreement with the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission to settle a lawsuit against the airline for selling seats on flights that had already been cancelled.

title.children: 'Egregious and unacceptable': Qantas agrees to $120 million settlement for selling tickets on cancelled flights

image.altText: A little penguin stares out of its burrow

props.synopsis: Testing is underway to determine the causes of death of more than 50 little penguins along South Australia's south coast this year, with up to 30 more reportedly washing up at Goolwa over the weekend.

title.children: Little penguin mass death under investigation as dozens of birds reportedly wash up on SA beach

image.altText: A nurse prepares for surgery wearing blue scrubs and a surgical mask and pulling on a pair of gloves in an operating theatre.

props.synopsis: Thousands of patients caught COVID in Victorian public hospitals in the past two years and hundreds died, fuelling concerns that health services aren't taking strong enough precautions against airborne viruses.

title.children: Hundreds of patients died after catching COVID in hospital, and experts say their deaths were preventable

image.altText: A woman wearing high-visibilty clothing stands on the deck of a ship with a marine listening device in her hands.

props.synopsis: Scientists have undertaken seven voyages totalling more than 100,000 kilometres and eight months at sea to build the most up-to-date snapshot of Antarctic blue whale distribution.

title.children: Antarctic blue whales are the largest animals on the planet but tricky to find
